pcalg module¶

Implementation of the PC algorithm. [1] Spirtes, Glymour, and Scheines, Causation, Prediction, and Search, 2nd ed. [2] Kalisch & Buhlmann, J Machine Learning Res 8, 613 (2007)

pcalg.can_orient(G, edge)[source]¶

Test whether edge should be oriented under PC algorithm rules for non-collider edges.

Parameters:
  • G – partially oriented graph
  • edge – edge of G under test
Returns:

True if edge should be oriented, False otherwise
pcalg.orient_colliders(skel, sep_set)[source]¶

Identify and orient colliders in skeleton.

Parameters:skel – skeleton graph calculated by get_skel
Returns:partially oriented graph as determined by colliders
pcalg.orient_edges(G)[source]¶

Orient remaining edges after colliders have been oriented.

Parameters:G – partially oriented graph (colliders oriented)
Returns:maximally oriented DAG
pcalg.pc(statdat, sig, verbose=True)[source]¶

Run PC algorithm on statistical data.

Parameters:
  • statdat – DataStats object containing input data
  • sig – confidence interval for conditional independence test, expressed in units of standard deviation
Returns:

G: causal DAG sep_set: d-separation dict, key = separated node pairs, value = d-separating set
